sourcesContent:
import MyCV from "../assets/Daniel Farrell CV.jpg"; import DownloadButton from "./CVDownload"; import styled from "styled-components"; const AboutMe = () => { return (

About Me

Biography

Daniel is currently pursuing a web development diploma, showcasing a strong foundation in programming fundamentals and an eagerness to delve into the complexities of web development. Armed with proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, he has embarked on an immersive journey to master both frontend and backend technologies. Daniel's learning path progresses seamlessly into the realm of Advanced Frontend with React, where he adeptly manipulates the Document Object Model (DOM) and delves into React's intricacies, including the application of React Hooks. The culmination of this knowledge is evident as he undertakes various individual web projects, demonstrating his prowess in crafting responsive and dynamic user interfaces.

Venturing into server-side programming with NodeJS, Daniel leverages his JavaScript skills to create and deploy robust web servers, embracing RESTful API principles with Express. Basic networking concepts such as HTTP are seamlessly integrated into his skill set, and he explores the integration of external APIs for data retrieval. The collaborative spirit of software development is not lost on Daniel, as he actively engages in a team project. Recognizing the diversity in coding styles and logics, he adeptly merges his own contributions, demonstrating a keen understanding of effective code collaboration while utilizing Git/GitHub for version control.

The incorporation of data persistence into backend projects marks Daniel's evolution in creating full-stack applications. Proficient in performing CRUD operations on MongoDB, he showcases his ability to seamlessly connect frontend and backend elements, laying the foundation for a comprehensive MERN (MongoDB, Express, React, Node.js) application. Undeterred by challenges, Daniel undertakes a solo project where he puts his acquired skills to the test. Responsible for conceiving, developing, and bringing to fruition a working prototype of his choice, Daniel exhibits not only technical acumen but also creativity and a problem-solving mindset.

Beyond the realm of web development, Daniel's background in Athletic Therapy adds a unique dimension to his profile. A graduate of Concordia University with a Bachelor of Science specializing in Athletic Therapy, he has honed his skills through internships with various sports teams and clinics. Daniel's work experience with the Montreal Impact Soccer Schools and Gym Klub 20 attests to his versatility, providing first aid to athletes and serving as a personal trainer. His commitment to continuous improvement is evident in completing education courses with TRX and NASM, showcasing expertise in areas such as Speed, Agility, Quickness Training, and Balance Training.

Daniel's life outside the gym and clinic mirrors his active approach to challenges. Having played hockey, soccer, and rugby for city and school teams, he not only embodies the spirit of teamwork but also exhibits a genuine passion for sports. This enthusiasm extends to his personal interests, including cycling, hiking, snowboarding, and serving as a soccer referee. A team player, problem solver, hard worker, and fast learner, Daniel brings a multifaceted skill set and a dynamic approach to every endeavor.

My CV

 ); }; export default AboutMe; const Container = styled.div` display: flex; flex-direction: column; align-items: center; width: 80vw; height: 80vh; margin: 0 auto; background-color: #fff; /* Set the background color of the box */ padding: 20px; /* Adjust padding as needed */ border: 1px solid #ccc; /* Add border if desired */ `; const ContentContainer = styled.div` display: flex; justify-content: space-between; align-items: center; `; const Column = styled.div` width: 48%; /* Adjust column width as needed */ text-align: center; `; const RightColumn = styled(Column)` img { max-width: 100%; height: auto; margin-top: 10px; /* Add margin between image and button */ } button { display: block; margin: 10px auto; /* Center the button */ } `;
